level-up.name: stomp
level-up.description:
The target is stomped with a big foot. This may also
make the target flinch.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: growl
level-up.description:
The user growls in an endearing way, making
opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their
Attack stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

level-up.name: confusion
level-up.description:
The target is hit by a weak telekinetic force.
This may also confuse the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

level-up.name: confusion
level-up.description:
The target is hit by a weak telekinetic force.
This may also confuse the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

make the target flinch.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.

level-up.name: agility
level-up.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: baton-pass
level-up.description:
The user switches places with a party Pokémon in
waiting and passes along any stat changes.
level-up.effect:
User switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  Stat changes, confusion, and persistent move effects are passed along to the replacement Pokémon.

The following move effects are passed:

* aqua ring
* both the user's and target's effect of block, mean look, and spider web
* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus energy or an activated lansat berry
* gastro acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech seed
* being targeted by lock on or mind reader
* magnet rise
* perish song's counter
* power trick
* substitute; the doll's HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.

level-up.name: psybeam
level-up.description:
The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. This may
also leave the target confused.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

level-up.name: crunch
level-up.description:
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

egg.name: take-down
egg.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: amnesia
egg.description:
The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its
concerns. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.
egg.effect: Raises the user's Special Defense by two stages.

egg.name: foresight
egg.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
egg.effect: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

egg.name: future-sight
egg.description:
Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic
energy attacks the target.
egg.effect:
Inflicts typeless regular damage at the end of the third turn, starting with this one.  This move cannot score a critical hit.  If the target switches out, its replacement will be hit instead.  Damage is calculated at the time this move is used; stat changes and switching out during the delay won't change the damage inflicted.  No move with this effect can be used against the same target again until after the end of the third turn.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

If the target is protected by protect or detect on the turn this move is used, this move will fail.  However, the damage on the third turn will break through protection.

The damage is applied at the end of the turn, so it ignores endure and focus sash.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

egg.name: beat-up
egg.description:
The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target.
The more party Pokémon, the greater the number
of attacks.
egg.effect:
Inflicts typeless regular damage.  Every Pokémon in the user's party, excepting those that have fainted or have a major status effect, attacks the target.  Calculated stats are ignored; the base stats for the target and assorted attackers are used instead.  The random factor in the damage formula is not used.  dark Pokémon still get STAB.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

tutor.name: thunderbolt
tutor.description:
A strong electric blast crashes down on the target.
This may also leave the target with paralysis.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: headbutt
machine.description:
The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging
straight into the target. This may also make the
target flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: curse
machine.description:
A move that works differently for the Ghost type
than for all other types.
machine.effect:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: zap-cannon
machine.description:
The user fires an electric blast like a cannon to inflict
damage and cause paralysis.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: rock-smash
machine.description:
The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: psych-up
machine.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat
change made by the target.
machine.effect:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: snore
machine.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
machine.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: endure
machine.description:
The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
machine.effect:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: iron-tail
machine.description:
The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: thunder
machine.description:
A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to
inflict damage. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During rain dance, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

During sunny day, this move has 50% accuracy.

machine.name: earthquake
machine.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: psychic
machine.description:
The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: shadow-ball
machine.description:
The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: mud-slap
machine.description:
The user hurls mud in the target’s face to inflict
damage and lower its accuracy.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: swift
machine.description:
Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon.
This attack never misses.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: dream-eater
machine.description:
The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target.
The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by
the target.
machine.effect: Fails if not used on a sleeping Pokémon.  Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: thief
machine.description:
The user attacks and steals the target’s held item
simultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it
already holds an item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: nightmare
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Only works on sleeping Pokémon.  Gives the target a nightmare, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.  If the target wakes up or leaves the field, this effect ends.

egg.name: wish
egg.description:
One turn after this move is used, the user’s or its
replacement’s HP is restored by half the user’s
max HP.
egg.effect: At the end of the next turn, user will be healed for half its max HP.  If the user is switched out, its replacement will be healed instead for half of the user's max HP.  If the user faints or is forcefully switched by roar or whirlwind, this effect will not activate.

egg.name: magic-coat
egg.description:
Moves like Leech Seed and moves that inflict status
conditions are blocked by a barrier and reflected back
to the user of those moves.
egg.effect:
The first non-damaging move targeting the user this turn that inflicts major status effects, stat changes, or trapping effects will be reflected at its user.

defog, memento, and teeter dance are not reflected.

attract, flatter, gastro acid, leech seed, swagger, worry seed, and yawn are reflected.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

tutor.name: body-slam
tutor.description:
The user drops onto the target with its full body
weight. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

tutor.name: double-edge
tutor.description:
A reckless, life-risking tackle in which the user rushes
the target. This also damages the user quite a lot.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

tutor.name: thunder-wave
tutor.description:
The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that
paralyzes the target.
tutor.effect: Paralyzes the target.

tutor.name: mimic
tutor.description:
The user copies the target’s last move. The move
can be used during battle until the Pokémon is
switched out.
tutor.effect:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

tutor.name: swift
tutor.description:
Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon.
This attack never misses.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

tutor.name: dream-eater
tutor.description:
The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target.
The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by
the target.
tutor.effect: Fails if not used on a sleeping Pokémon.  Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

tutor.name: substitute
tutor.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
tutor.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

tutor.name: psych-up
tutor.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat
change made by the target.
tutor.effect:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: calm-mind
machine.description:
The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its
spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each.

machine.name: flash
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: rock-smash
machine.description:
The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: light-screen
machine.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage
from special attacks for five turns.
machine.effect:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from special attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: iron-tail
machine.description:
The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: thunderbolt
machine.description:
A strong electric blast crashes down on the target.
This may also leave the target with paralysis.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: thunder
machine.description:
A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to
inflict damage. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During rain dance, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

During sunny day, this move has 50% accuracy.

machine.name: earthquake
machine.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: psychic
machine.description:
The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: shadow-ball
machine.description:
The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: reflect
machine.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage
from physical attacks for five turns.
machine.effect:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: shock-wave
machine.description:
The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of
electricity. This attack never misses.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: secret-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyzes target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyzes target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyzes target
Neon           | Paralyzes target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: thief
machine.description:
The user attacks and steals the target’s held item
simultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it
already holds an item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: skill-swap
machine.description:
The user employs its psychic power to exchange
Abilities with the target.
machine.effect:
User and target switch abilities.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If either Pokémon has multitype or wonder guard, this move will fail.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: growl
level-up.description:
The user growls in an endearing way, making
opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their
Attack stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

level-up.name: confusion
level-up.description:
The target is hit by a weak telekinetic force.
This may also confuse the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

level-up.name: astonish
level-up.description:
The user attacks the target while shouting in a
startling fashion. This may also make the
target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: power-swap
level-up.description:
The user employs its psychic power to switch
changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with
the target.
level-up.effect: User swaps its Attack and Special Attack stat modifiers modifiers with the target.

level-up.name: guard-swap
level-up.description:
The user employs its psychic power to switch
changes to its Defense and Sp. Def stats with
the target.
level-up.effect: User swaps its Defense and Special Defense modifiers with the target.

level-up.name: odor-sleuth
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

level-up.name: stomp
level-up.description:
The target is stomped with a big foot. This may also
make the target flinch.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.

level-up.name: agility
level-up.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: psybeam
level-up.description:
The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. This may
also leave the target confused.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

level-up.name: baton-pass
level-up.description:
The user switches places with a party Pokémon in
waiting and passes along any stat changes.
level-up.effect:
User switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  Stat changes, confusion, and persistent move effects are passed along to the replacement Pokémon.

The following move effects are passed:

* aqua ring
* both the user's and target's effect of block, mean look, and spider web
* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus energy or an activated lansat berry
* gastro acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech seed
* being targeted by lock on or mind reader
* magnet rise
* perish song's counter
* power trick
* substitute; the doll's HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.

level-up.name: assurance
level-up.description:
If the target has already taken some damage in the
same turn, this attack’s power is doubled.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target takes damage this turn for any reason before this move is used, this move has double power.

level-up.name: double-hit
level-up.description:
The user slams the target with a long tail, vines, or a
tentacle. The target is hit twice in a row.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits twice in one turn.

level-up.name: psychic
level-up.description:
The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: zen-headbutt
level-up.description:
The user focuses its willpower to its head and
attacks the target. This may also make the
target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: crunch
level-up.description:
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

egg.name: double-kick
egg.description:
The target is quickly kicked twice in succession
using both feet.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits twice in one turn.

egg.name: take-down
egg.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: amnesia
egg.description:
The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its
concerns. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.
egg.effect: Raises the user's Special Defense by two stages.

egg.name: foresight
egg.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
egg.effect: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

egg.name: mirror-coat
egg.description:
A retaliation move that counters any special attack,
inflicting double the damage taken.
egg.effect:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a special move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: psych-up
egg.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat
change made by the target.
egg.effect:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

egg.name: future-sight
egg.description:
Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic
energy attacks the target.
egg.effect:
Inflicts typeless regular damage at the end of the third turn, starting with this one.  This move cannot score a critical hit.  If the target switches out, its replacement will be hit instead.  Damage is calculated at the time this move is used; stat changes and switching out during the delay won't change the damage inflicted.  No move with this effect can be used against the same target again until after the end of the third turn.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

If the target is protected by protect or detect on the turn this move is used, this move will fail.  However, the damage on the third turn will break through protection.

The damage is applied at the end of the turn, so it ignores endure and focus sash.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

egg.name: beat-up
egg.description:
The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target.
The more party Pokémon, the greater the number
of attacks.
egg.effect:
Inflicts typeless regular damage.  Every Pokémon in the user's party, excepting those that have fainted or have a major status effect, attacks the target.  Calculated stats are ignored; the base stats for the target and assorted attackers are used instead.  The random factor in the damage formula is not used.  dark Pokémon still get STAB.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

egg.name: wish
egg.description:
One turn after this move is used, the user’s or its
replacement’s HP is restored by half the user’s
max HP.
egg.effect: At the end of the next turn, user will be healed for half its max HP.  If the user is switched out, its replacement will be healed instead for half of the user's max HP.  If the user faints or is forcefully switched by roar or whirlwind, this effect will not activate.

egg.name: magic-coat
egg.description:
Moves like Leech Seed and moves that inflict status
conditions are blocked by a barrier and reflected back
to the user of those moves.
egg.effect:
The first non-damaging move targeting the user this turn that inflicts major status effects, stat changes, or trapping effects will be reflected at its user.

defog, memento, and teeter dance are not reflected.

attract, flatter, gastro acid, leech seed, swagger, worry seed, and yawn are reflected.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

tutor.name: swift
tutor.description:
Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon.
This attack never misses.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

tutor.name: snore
tutor.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
tutor.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: mud-slap
tutor.description:
The user hurls mud in the target’s face to inflict
damage and lower its accuracy.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

tutor.name: uproar
tutor.description:
The user attacks in an uproar for three turns.
During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

tutor.name: trick
tutor.description:
The user catches the target off guard and swaps its
held item with its own.
tutor.effect:
User and target permanently swap held items.  Works even if one of the Pokémon isn't holding anything.  If either Pokémon is holding mail, this move will fail.

If either Pokémon has multitype or sticky hold, this move will fail.

If this move results in a Pokémon obtaining choice band, choice scarf, or choice specs, and that Pokémon was the latter of the pair to move this turn, then the move it used this turn becomes its chosen forced move.  This applies even if both Pokémon had a choice item before this move was used.  If the first of the two Pokémon gains a choice item, it may select whatever choice move it wishes next turn.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: signal-beam
tutor.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

tutor.name: sucker-punch
tutor.description:
This move enables the user to attack first. This move
fails if the target is not readying an attack.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has not selected a damaging move this turn, or if the target has already acted this turn, this move will fail.

This move is not affected by iron fist.

target flinch.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration

This move can’t be used.

If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: thief
machine.description:
The user attacks and steals the target’s held item
simultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it
already holds an item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: skill-swap
machine.description:
The user employs its psychic power to exchange
Abilities with the target.
machine.effect:
User and target switch abilities.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If either Pokémon has multitype or wonder guard, this move will fail.

machine.name: energy-ball
machine.description:
The user draws power from nature and fires it at the
target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: charge-beam
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with an electric charge. The
user may use any remaining electricity to raise its
Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 70% chance to raise the user's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: endure
machine.description:
The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
machine.effect:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: recycle
machine.description:
The user recycles a held item that has been used in
battle so it can be used again.
machine.effect:
User recovers the last item consumed by the user or a Pokémon in its position on the field.  The item must be used again before it can be recovered by this move again.  If the user is holding an item, this move fails.

Items taken or given away by covet, knock off, switcheroo, thief, or trick may not be recovered.

machine.name: flash
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.description:
The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that
paralyzes the target.
machine.effect: Paralyzes the target.

machine.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat
change made by the target.
machine.effect:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: captivate
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: natural-gift
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

machine.name: dream-eater
machine.description:
The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target.
The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by
the target.
machine.effect: Fails if not used on a sleeping Pokémon.  Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: trick-room
machine.description:
The user creates a bizarre area in which slower
Pokémon get to move first for five turns.
machine.effect:
For five turns (including this one), slower Pokémon will act before faster Pokémon.  Move priority is not affected.  Using this move when its effect is already active will end the effect.

Pokémon holding full incense, lagging tail, or quick claw and Pokémon with stall ignore this effect.

level-up.name: baton-pass

waiting and passes along any stat changes.
level-up.effect:
User switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  Stat changes, confusion, and persistent move effects are passed along to the replacement Pokémon.

The following move effects are passed:

* aqua ring
* both the user's and target's effect of block, mean look, and spider web
* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus energy or an activated lansat berry
* gastro acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech seed
* being targeted by lock on or mind reader
* magnet rise
* perish song's counter
* power trick
* substitute; the doll's HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.

egg.description:
A retaliation move that counters any special attack,
inflicting double the damage taken.
egg.effect:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a special move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: future-sight
egg.description:
Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic
energy attacks the target.
egg.effect:
Inflicts typeless regular damage at the end of the third turn, starting with this one.  This move cannot score a critical hit.  If the target switches out, its replacement will be hit instead.  Damage is calculated at the time this move is used; stat changes and switching out during the delay won't change the damage inflicted.  No move with this effect can be used against the same target again until after the end of the third turn.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

If the target is protected by protect or detect on the turn this move is used, this move will fail.  However, the damage on the third turn will break through protection.

The damage is applied at the end of the turn, so it ignores endure and focus sash.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

egg.name: beat-up

The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target.
The more party Pokémon, the greater the number
of attacks.

Inflicts typeless regular damage.  Every Pokémon in the user's party, excepting those that have fainted or have a major status effect, attacks the target.  Calculated stats are ignored; the base stats for the target and assorted attackers are used instead.  The random factor in the damage formula is not used.  dark Pokémon still get STAB.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

replacement’s HP is restored by half the user’s
max HP.
egg.effect: At the end of the next turn, user will be healed for half its max HP.  If the user is switched out, its replacement will be healed instead for half of the user's max HP.  If the user faints or is forcefully switched by roar or whirlwind, this effect will not activate.

defog, memento, and teeter dance are not reflected.

attract, flatter, gastro acid, leech seed, swagger, worry seed, and yawn are reflected.

tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: signal-beam
tutor.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

tutor.name: gravity
tutor.description:
This move enables Flying-type Pokémon or Pokémon
with the Levitate Ability to be hit by Ground-type
moves. Moves that involve flying can’t be used.
tutor.effect:
For five turns (including this one), all immunities to ground moves are disabled.  For the duration of this effect, the evasion of every Pokémon on the field is lowered by two stages.  Cancels the effects of bounce, fly, and sky drop.

Specifically, flying Pokémon and those with levitate or that have used magnet rise are no longer immune to ground attacks, arena trap, spikes, or toxic spikes.

bounce, fly, sky drop, high jump kick, jump kick, and splash cannot be used while this move is in effect.

*Bug*: If this move is used during a double or triple battle while Pokémon are under the effect of sky drop, Sky Drop's effect is not correctly canceled on its target, and it remains high in the air indefinitely.  As Sky Drop prevents the target from acting, the only way to subsequently remove it from the field is to faint it.

tutor.name: zen-headbutt
tutor.description:
The user focuses its willpower to its head and
attacks the target. This may also make the
target flinch.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: foul-play
tutor.description:
The user turns the target’s power against it.
The higher the target’s Attack stat, the greater
the damage it deals.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage is calculated using the target's attacking stat rather than the user's.

machine.name: psyshock
machine.description:
The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack
the target. This attack does physical damage.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage calculation always uses the target's Defense, regardless of this move's damage class.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: calm-mind
machine.description:
The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its
spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: light-screen
machine.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage
from special attacks for five turns.
machine.effect:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from special attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: telekinesis

This effect is removed by gravity.  If Gravity is already in effect, this move will fail.

During sunny day, this move has 50% accuracy.

brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: facade

poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:

restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: thief
machine.description:
The user attacks and steals the target’s held item
simultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it
already holds an item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: echoed-voice
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with an echoing voice.
If this move is used every turn, its power
is increased.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If any friendly Pokémon used this move earlier this turn or on the previous turn, that use's power is added to this move's power, to a maximum of 200.

machine.description:

target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Sp. Atk stat.

machine.name: grass-knot

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: trick-room
machine.description:
The user creates a bizarre area in which slower
Pokémon get to move first for five turns.
machine.effect:
For five turns (including this one), slower Pokémon will act before faster Pokémon.  Move priority is not affected.  Using this move when its effect is already active will end the effect.

Pokémon holding full incense, lagging tail, or quick claw and Pokémon with stall ignore this effect.

level-up.name: agility

level-up.name: psybeam

level-up.name: baton-pass
level-up.description:
The user switches places with a party Pokémon in
waiting and passes along any stat changes.
level-up.effect:
User switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  Stat changes, confusion, and persistent move effects are passed along to the replacement Pokémon.

The following move effects are passed:

* aqua ring
* both the user's and target's effect of block, mean look, and spider web
* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus energy or an activated lansat berry
* gastro acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech seed
* being targeted by lock on or mind reader
* magnet rise
* perish song's counter
* power trick
* substitute; the doll's HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.

level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target takes damage this turn for any reason before this move is used, this move has double power.

egg.effect: Raises the user's Special Defense by two stages.

egg.name: foresight
egg.description:
This move can’t be used.

egg.effect: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

egg.name: mean-look

egg.name: mirror-coat
egg.description:
A retaliation move that counters any special attack,
inflicting double the damage taken.
egg.effect:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a special move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: future-sight
egg.description:
Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic
energy attacks the target.
egg.effect:
Inflicts typeless regular damage at the end of the third turn, starting with this one.  This move cannot score a critical hit.  If the target switches out, its replacement will be hit instead.  Damage is calculated at the time this move is used; stat changes and switching out during the delay won't change the damage inflicted.  No move with this effect can be used against the same target again until after the end of the third turn.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

If the target is protected by protect or detect on the turn this move is used, this move will fail.  However, the damage on the third turn will break through protection.

The damage is applied at the end of the turn, so it ignores endure and focus sash.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

egg.name: beat-up
egg.description:
The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target.
The more party Pokémon, the greater the number
of attacks.
egg.effect:
Inflicts typeless regular damage.  Every Pokémon in the user's party, excepting those that have fainted or have a major status effect, attacks the target.  Calculated stats are ignored; the base stats for the target and assorted attackers are used instead.  The random factor in the damage formula is not used.  dark Pokémon still get STAB.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

egg.name: wish
egg.description:
One turn after this move is used, the user’s or its
replacement’s HP is restored by half the user’s
max HP.
egg.effect: At the end of the next turn, user will be healed for half its max HP.  If the user is switched out, its replacement will be healed instead for half of the user's max HP.  If the user faints or is forcefully switched by roar or whirlwind, this effect will not activate.

defog, memento, and teeter dance are not reflected.

attract, flatter, gastro acid, leech seed, swagger, worry seed, and yawn are reflected.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

egg.name: secret-power

egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyzes target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyzes target
